title: ã€ŒEnd User Registrationã€
body:
### Who is using Apache HertzBeatï¼Ÿ  

Thank you very much for your attention and support to hertzbeat. This is the biggest motivation for us to move forward.      

### The original intention of this issue

- Learn more about the practical use scenarios of hertzbeat and listen to the community to make hertzbeat better.    
- We want to attract more partners to contribute to hertzbeat.  

### We look forward to your registration      

You can refer to the below:    

````
Organization: TanCloud
Location: On the Moon
Contact: who@outlook.com
Purpose: xxxxx
````

### Thanks again for your participation!

Usage experience: I am very happy to see such excellent open source monitoring products on github. Business monitoring is part of my work. I also use other products (such as open source zabbix and some other paid products from other manufacturers) to compare with other products , when you feel the advantages of hertbeat, it is intuitive and convenient to use, but it may not be long after it has been developed, and its functions may not be as powerful as some old-fashioned products. Looking forward to subsequent updates. : )

### Collect metrics

#### Indicator collection: basic

| Indicator Name | Indicator Unit | Indicator Help Description |
| ----------- | ----------- | ----------- |
| database_version | none | database version |
| database_type | none | database type |
| hostname | none | hostname |
| instance_name | None | DB instance name |
| startup_time | none | database startup time |
| status | none | database status |

#### Indicator collection: tablespace

| Indicator Name | Indicator Unit | Indicator Help Description |
| ----------- | ----------- | ----------- |
| file_id | None | File ID |
| file_name | none | file name |
| tablespace_name | none | owning tablespace name |

#### Metrics collection: performance

| Indicator Name | Indicator Unit | Indicator Help Description |
| ----------- | ----------- | ----------- |
| qps | QPS | I/O Requests per Second Number of IO requests per second |
| tps | TPS | User Transaction Per Sec The number of user transactions per second |
| mbps | MBPS | I/O Megabytes per Second I/O megabytes per second |

----    
Haha thanks ğŸ™ for these suggestions, I am very happy to get such a review.

1. The global monitoring search of the page: For example, my resource name: TELNET_10.10.10.100_any node server_8088, I searched for Chinese "casual", etc., there may be no results, and there is no result for "8088" ğŸ˜”

> This seems to be a bug, I will fix it later.

2. List time display problems, the best standard is: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss format (year, month, day, hour, minute, second, 24-hour format), the current display is indeed not conducive to viewing

> get This needs to be changed. Now it is the UTC time directly used, which is not easy to view.

4. Database monitoring always times out, and the detection is OK.

> I will reproduce this to see if it is a bug or other configuration reasons. At present, the time-out is hard-coded, so I will expose the timeout in the next version so that it can be configured.

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Currently, alarm forwarding is to directly forward all triggered alarms. In a common situation, certain alarm information needs to be forwarded to a designated recipient.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
We need to support the selection and configuration of alarms that specify which monitoring types to forward and which alarm severity alarm information to forward when alarms are forwarded.

hi this needs to be considered
Currently, all indicators under the indicator set are supported for custom combination alarms. For example, the threshold expression configuration of total-total memory free-free memory `total>432432&&free>=234343` under the Linux memory memory.
However, it does not support the combination of threshold expressions across indicator sets, such as the indicators below the cpu indicator set and the indicators below the memory.
This kind of cross-collection indicators have not found a good way to calculate the correlation, because they are not collected at the same time.

body:
> Bot detected the issue body's language is not English, translate it automatically. ğŸ‘¯ğŸ‘­ğŸ»ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ§‘ğŸ‘«ğŸ§‘ğŸ¿â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ§‘ğŸ»ğŸ‘©ğŸ¾â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ‘¨ğŸ¿ğŸ‘¬ğŸ¿         
----    
Thank you for your feedback. Useful suggestions
> 1. Many developers, non-professional server operation and maintenance personnel, more often go back after Free -h and then go back and write regularities and put together the server. It is very difficult to use AWK.
I hope that you can add a custom parseType here, and then you can use reflection or JS engine to dynamically parse commands and return results

This is possible, but you need to consider how to call the implementation parsing script

> 2. Can the configmap be written as a configuration array or map when collecting, and the subscript or key is directly written on the protocol side to get it, and there is less configuration.

This is already planned for support. At present, configmap is key-value, but it cannot meet some scenarios such as adding headers, and strive to support it as soon as possible.

> 3. When encountering some comprehensive collections, such as executing SSH first, then executing SQL, and even calling some HTTP requests, can we use reflection to expand and open?

You are talking about a monitoring type such as MYSQL, you may need to collect ssh to monitor the host CPU memory, and also need to execute SQL query database indicators. It is currently supported. In the monitoring definition yml, configure different collections for different indicators Agreement is fine.

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
A large number of monitoring will be troublesome if you manually configure and add it on the page

**Describe the solution you'd like**

If you can scan and automatically discover existing services based on IP segments or other conditions, and automatically manage them into the monitoring system, it will greatly reduce the workload of operation and maintenance.

This requirement currently sees a large workload, and needs to consider automatic scanning, monitoring parameter configuration, application of default port association on the opposite end, automatic addition, monitoring of duplicate judgment rules, etc.

> Bot detected the issue body's language is not English, translate it automatically. ğŸ‘¯ğŸ‘­ğŸ»ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ§‘ğŸ‘«ğŸ§‘ğŸ¿â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ§‘ğŸ»ğŸ‘©ğŸ¾â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ‘¨ğŸ¿ğŸ‘¬ğŸ¿         
----    
In enterprises with standardized operation and maintenance management, the root account is not allowed to log in directly to collect data. And like some databases, such as Oracle, non-root needs to be able to perform system-level queries after granting the relevant tables or views one by one. Similar linux will refuse to execute some commands because of environment volume and user group. After the number of commands increases, not only should you check which statement is the problem, but also contact the operation and maintenance personnel to empower them to add permissions.
You want to enter the root account during initialization, select automatic establishment or authorization, and collect various permissions of the account. The system does not save the information of the root user.
And when the collection rules are rewritten, subsequent empowerment is required.

----    
@tomsun28 Well, found the documentation, another project of yours: https://github.com/dromara/sureness.
By the way, provide my guest configuration
````yml
## -- sureness.yml text data source -- ##

# Load the resource that matches the dictionary, that is, the resource that needs to be protected, and the resource that supports the role access is set
# Unconfigured resources are also protected by authentication by default, but not authenticated
# eg: /api/v1/source1===get===[role2] means /api/v2/host===post this resource supports role2 access
# eg: /api/v1/source2===get===[] means /api/v1/source2===get This resource does not support any role access
resourceRole:
  - /account/auth/refresh===get,post===[admin,visitor]
  - /apps/**===get===[admin,visitor]
  - /monitor/**===get===[admin,visitor]
  - /monitor/**===post===[admin]
  - /monitor/**===put===[admin]
  - /monitor/**===delete==[admin]
  - /monitors/**===get===[admin,visitor]
  - /monitors/**===post===[admin]
  - /monitors/**===put===[admin]
  - /monitors/**===delete===[admin]
  - /notice/**===get===[admin,visitor]
  - /notice/**===post===[admin]
  - /notice/**===put===[admin]
  - /notice/**===delete===[admin]
  - /summary/**===get===[admin,visitor]
  - /summary/**===post===[admin]
  - /summary/**===put===[admin]
  - /summary/**===delete===[admin]

# Resource that needs to be protected by filtering, directly access without authentication
# /api/v1/source3===get means /api/v1/source3===get can be accessed by anyone without login authentication
excludedResource:
  - /account/auth/**===*
  - /===get
  - /i18n/**===get
  - /apps/hierarchy===get
  # web ui static resources
  - /console/**===get
  - /**/*.html===get
  - /**/*.js===get
  - /**/*.css===get
  - /**/*.ico===get
  - /**/*.ttf===get
  - /**/*.png===get
  - /**/*.gif===get
    - /**/*.png===*
  # swagger ui resources
  - /swagger-resources/**===get
  - /v2/api-docs===get
  - /v3/api-docs===get

# User account information
# There are three accounts of admin tom lili below
# eg: admin has the role of [role1,role2], the password is admin
# eg: tom has [role1,role2,role3], the password is tom@123
# eg: lili has [role1,role2], the plaintext password is lili, and the salted password is 1A676730B0C7F54654B0E09184448289
account:
  - appId: admin
    credential: xxx
    role: [ admin ]
  - appId: visitor
    credential: xxx
    role: [ visitor ]
````

title: NA
body:
> Bot detected the issue body's language is not English, translate it automatically. ğŸ‘¯ğŸ‘­ğŸ»ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ§‘ğŸ‘«ğŸ§‘ğŸ¿â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ§‘ğŸ»ğŸ‘©ğŸ¾â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ‘¨ğŸ¿ğŸ‘¬ğŸ¿         
----    
As the version is upgraded again and again, new features and functions, bug fixes, etc., when it comes to the adjustment of the database table, the upgrade script of the database table can be provided together. Like I just started using it before, I feel good, and maintain a large amount of monitoring data. Now that our database table structure has changed, I need to manually migrate the data, which is very time-consuming.

Every time the database is adjusted, it can provide the changes of the database and the last time. Although I can export the current database table structure and compare it with the new database script, the order after the export is also different. In the end, it is still necessary to submit the records. It takes time to find the previous ones.

It would be even better if you could **provide the database and the last changes** and also provide the script for the migration of the old data!

> If the new data table field is required and other information, you can give the default value, of course, we can also change the default value by ourselves!

Hi thanks for the feedback. This issue should really be taken seriously. Currently, there is no relational table structure change corresponding to mysql in the recent two versions, but due to the modification and addition of indicators, the table structure corresponding to TDengine may change. Automatically created, this piece is really not thoughtful, tdengine will affect the display of historical chart data.
Later, we will study the upgrade of the indicator table.

----    
As an APM, I hope that different projects can be aggregated by grouping/tag.
For example, a project has both http monitoring, ping monitoring, and tcp monitoring; any service problem in this project can notify someone.
In addition, it is best to add a description field to all items so that the monitoring personnel know what this is for.

tdengine installation
````
docker run -d -p 6030-6049:6030-6049 -p 6030-6049:6030-6049/udp -v /opt/taosdata:/root/hertbeat/taos --name tdengine -e TZ=Asia/Shanghai tdengine/ tdengine:2.4.0.12

````

After the alarm is recovered, the original fault alarm information is still displayed as unhandled
![1653116133(1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/105963325/169639932-f711db0e-088a-4f80-ade3-2215834d2dd9.png)

To eliminate these alarm messages, you need to select the messages in the unprocessed state in the alarm center and manually change them to processed.

title: Discussion for OSPP and Project Setup Issue
body:
Hey I am Raag Bhutani, a Computer Science undergrad at University Institute of Engineering Technology, Panjab University, India, and a keen enthusiast in web development.

I am interested in contributing to "**Hertzbeat official website UI revision and document i18n**" project.

**However I am having some difficulties in setting up the project .** 

I am trying to set up the project through "Method 1: Quick installation by Docker". After  setting up docker on desktop and  pulling out the HertzBeat Docker image , and after running

**Command** :  "docker run -d -p 1157:1157 -v /opt/application.yml:/opt/hertzbeat/config/application.yml -v /opt/sureness.yml:/opt/hertzbeat/config/sureness.yml --name hertzbeat tancloud/hertzbeat:[ç‰ˆæœ¬tag] 526aa188da767ae94b244226a2b2eec2b5f17dd8eff592893d9ec0cd0f3a1ccd" by changing the path too : "Error response from daemon: invalid mode: /Projects/OSPP/hertzbeat-1.0-beta.8/script/application.yml."

Probably there's something to do with application.yml file. 

And I can't figure out how to communicate with the community, as WeChat exchange group and QQ exchange group aren't working.
Does the community have slack, zulip ,etc, through which I can communicate with the mentors for the OSPP program. 

I would be really grateful if I could get some help on this and directions to work on this project.

Thank You

title: NA
body:
hi welcome, you can contact the project mentor  @shimingxy using email [shimh@maxsso.net](mailto:shimh@maxsso.net) , or discuss in  https://github.com/dromara/hertzbeat/discussions , we will open slack later.   

> **However I am having some difficulties in setting up the project .**
> 
> I am trying to set up the project through "Method 1: Quick installation by Docker". After setting up docker on desktop and pulling out the HertzBeat Docker image , and after running
> 
> **Command** : "docker run -d -p 1157:1157 -v /opt/application.yml:/opt/hertzbeat/config/application.yml -v /opt/sureness.yml:/opt/hertzbeat/config/sureness.yml --name hertzbeat tancloud/hertzbeat:[ç‰ˆæœ¬tag] 526aa188da767ae94b244226a2b2eec2b5f17dd8eff592893d9ec0cd0f3a1ccd" by changing the path too : "Error response from daemon: invalid mode: /Projects/OSPP/hertzbeat-1.0-beta.8/script/application.yml."
> 
> Probably there's something to do with application.yml file.

HertzBeat depends at least on relational database [MYSQL5+](https://www.mysql.com/) and time series database [TDengine2+](https://www.taosdata.com/getting-started) (optional), and we should config the application.yml or the sureness.yml(optional) in local machine before `docker run`   

here is the quickstart document https://hertzbeat.com/en/docs/start/quickstart    

best wish

Hertzbeat can be used normally at the beginning, but it will break into the situation of hertzbeat suspended animation, that is: hertzbeat can no longer be accessed on the browser. At this time, if you check the resource usage, you will find that the CPU is basically full and the memory is basically consumed. After restarting hertzbeat, it returns to normal, and you can access hertzbeat normally

> Bot detected the issue body's language is not English, translate it automatically. ğŸ‘¯ğŸ‘­ğŸ»ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ§‘ğŸ‘«ğŸ§‘ğŸ¿â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ§‘ğŸ»ğŸ‘©ğŸ¾â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ‘¨ğŸ¿ğŸ‘¬ğŸ¿         
----    
First of all, thanks to the open source project, the script that was previously fragmented can be transformed into a platform to manage and monitor.

Here I hope to add an alarm that can be based on time, such as the expiration reminder of some WeChat public accounts or cloud servers in the company. These reminders may be reminders to mobile phone numbers or email addresses, and even some people leave the account and cause the account to not be updated in time. The actual operator is here, so I hope to add a function similar to the overdue alarm, which can be configured through the alarm platform and then sent DingTalk or WeChat notifications. The current custom monitoring still needs to be triggered by an http request. The expiration alarm here does not actually require a request, but only needs an expiration time.

> Bot detected the issue body's language is not English, translate it automatically. ğŸ‘¯ğŸ‘­ğŸ»ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ§‘ğŸ‘«ğŸ§‘ğŸ¿â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ§‘ğŸ»ğŸ‘©ğŸ¾â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ‘¨ğŸ¿ğŸ‘¬ğŸ¿         
----    
I see that similar monitoring tools are actively detected, and I think a passive function needs to be added.
You can refer to https://healthchecks.io/

The gameplay of passive monitoring:
The services that need to be monitored regularly report data to the monitoring machine through the http interface, or just report safety. If there is no report for a period of time, or the data is wrong, an alarm will be issued.

Uses of passive monitoring:
1. apm is located on the public network, and the services to be monitored are located on the intranet.
2. Simplify the alarm logic, and the reporting machine determines when an alarm is required.
3. The reporting machine can run scripts on crontab, and can run more complex logic through monit.

Example:
1. Run mysql backup every day, tell the monitoring machine that I have finished the backup after the backup
2. The intranet monitors a certain piece of data through the database, and regularly tells the monitoring machine that this data is OK
3. Run a script on the home network to monitor the IP of the dynamic dial-up, and tell the monitoring machine if it is updated. This is more convenient than monitoring the ddns update by the monitoring machine.

----    
jsonpath configures the yml definition script when custom monitoring. The keyword here means how many keywords are in the content returned by the match. For example, there should be one for jvm.
I think what you want to achieve should be to collect the value of the heap_used_precent indicator. This can be achieved through http custom monitoring configuration jsonpath

title: Historical Chart has no metrics data with tdengine 2.6.0.14
body:
**Describe the bug**
"Monitor Historical Chart Detail" returns No metric data.

**Used Version**  
Docker v1.1.2.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Setup Mysql in a external machine, and get it working.
2. Setup TDEngine in a extenal machine, and get it working.
3. Setup Hertzbeat as a docker container, and check if it writes into databases: it does.
4. Service monitor -> Ping 192.168.1.1 -> Monitor Historical Chart Detail 
5. Error

**Expected behavior**
Be able to see graphs.

**Screenshots**
![Captura](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42719382/185790835-80df72f0-cf02-477f-a7b3-4b6c624cd787.JPG)

This was the service I was looking for, it's perfect. What a shame I can not get it working :(

We found a phenomenon of jvm monitoring. We provided a lot of monitoring indicators, but the documentation is slightly thin. Is it possible to consider adding in the document: 1. Which indicators need to be monitored in actual production, and what threshold (or range) is appropriate to set. For example, we generally want to know when to increase xmx. 2. When the index is abnormal, whether there is a corresponding configuration item to reduce the abnormal index, that is, the corresponding relationship between the index and the configuration.

title: [Task] support vmware vcenter monitor via vijava or rest api.
body:
### Description

Support vmware vcenter monitor. 
Via vijava sdk https://github.com/yavijava/yavijava.   
Or via Rest API https://developer.vmware.com/apis/vsphere-automation/latest/vcenter/authentication.html.

### Task List

- [ ]   Build the vcenter environment
- [ ]  Use Rest Api Authenticate vcenter or use vijava sdk.
- [ ]  Collect metrics.

### Question

The length of API parameters in API monitoring cannot exceed 200. Can this limit be canceled or changed so that API parameters do not exceed 500? There are many API parameters in our company, and the length of the parameter value is also long, resulting in many APIs whose length exceeds 200. Thank you in advance for open-sourcing such an excellent product!

expectedï¼š the code_cache show success

HertzBeat version(v2.0)

title: NA
body: JMX Metrics: java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=Code Cache In JRE8 BUT NOT JRE11. In JRE11, CodeHeap 'non-nmethods' and CodeHeap 'non-profiled nmethods' instead of it. JRE8: JRE11: It's very hard to compatible with both versions. Suggest we add attention document in hertzbeat doc to note that the `Code Cache` only support jre8 OR remove this metrics in jvm monitor.

Set the data expiration time, and execute the set ttl to root.hertzbeat xxx statement after the session is started (Note: At present, the ttl of IoTDB only supports milliseconds and needs to be converted)
The expiration time is managed by configuration and can be customized by users. The default is 3 months, and -1 means never expires.

title: [Question] <java å†…å­˜æº¢å‡ºï¼Ÿå ç”¨è¿‡é«˜è™šæ‹Ÿå†…å­˜ç»å¸¸10gä»¥ä¸Š>
body:

title: There are problems in collecting cpu cores and interrupts under Oracle Linux based on arm architecture
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Current Behavior

Under the Oracle Linux based on the arm architecture, there is a problem in collecting cpu cores and interrupt, and it will display&nbsp
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15188754/200468908-795eb151-2434-475d-a235-9771cc92082a.png)

After analyzing the source code, it is found that it is a script for collecting cpu, and there are some compatibility problems

Original collection script

LANG=C lscpu | awk -F: '/Model name/ {print $2}';awk '/processor/{core++} END{print core}' /proc/cpuinfo;uptime | sed 's/,/ /g' | awk '{for(i=NF-2;i<=NF;i++)print $i }' | xargs;vmstat 1 1 | awk 'NR==3{print $11}';vmstat 1 1 | awk 'NR==3{print $12}';vmstat 1 1 | awk 'NR==3{print $15}'

Where LANG=C lscpu | awk -F: '/Model name/ {print $2}'; , because Oracle Linux will have two nodes,  the Model Name and BIOS Model Name, so there are two lines of records when getting info

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15188754/200469192-1fe53600-2265-409f-a835-32db7f705fc8.png)

I changed it to

LANG=C lscpu | awk -F: '$1==\"Model name\" {print $2}';awk '/processor/{core++} END{print core}' /proc/cpuinfo;uptime | sed 's/,/ /g' | awk '{for(i=NF-2;i<=NF;i++)print $i }' | xargs;vmstat 1 1 | awk 'NR==3{print $11}';vmstat 1 1 | awk 'NR==3{print $12}';vmstat 1 1 | awk 'NR==3{print $15}'

The script that gets info  LANG=C lscpu | awk -F: '$1==\"Model name\" {print $2}';

### Expected Behavior

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15188754/200469490-0de54fe6-99e1-426a-8f12-d77b1cc98069.png)


### Steps To Reproduce

_No response_

### Environment

```markdown
HertzBeat version(s):  latest version
```


### Debug logs

_No response_

### Anything else?

_No response_

----    
### Question

1. For example, in the same intranet, due to security isolation, node A can only communicate with 192.168.0.0/24, and node B can only communicate with 172.16.0.0/24. In this case, I have to deploy two sets of hertzbeat systems.

Like the previous open source method:
blackbox_exporter+prometheus+grafana, blackbox can be deployed on multiple detection points, and at least one Prometheus is deployed, so this combination can solve the above problems.

So I want to solve a similar problem, is there any good solution you can provide?

grateful.

> Bot detected the issue body's language is not English, translate it automatically. ğŸ‘¯ğŸ‘­ğŸ»ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ§‘ğŸ‘«ğŸ§‘ğŸ¿â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ§‘ğŸ»ğŸ‘©ğŸ¾â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ‘¨ğŸ¿ğŸ‘¬ğŸ¿         
----    
hi @dadapapapa In addition to the pull mode without an agent, we are also promoting a push server similar to the promethues pushgateway, providing an interface for actively reporting indicators. In the next version, we will support the adaptation of the promethues exporter data protocol, and all the indicators that can be captured on the exporter can be adapted to hertzbeat. If `blackbox_exporter` is the same as other exporters, theoretically you can use `blackbox_exporter` + `hertzbeat`.

For the monitoring of different isolated networks, we actually have another idea. The hertzbeat collectors are separated, and only collectors are deployed in each network, and aggregated to one hertzbeat server. However, this demand should not be arranged in the near future.

title: [BUG] not alerting when website is down
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Current Behavior

When a website in WEBSITE Monitor (/monitors?app=website), is down by shutting down nginx, HertzBeat just kept saying it's "Available" in web interface and stopped monitoring this website. When I restarted nginx, History Graph in HertzBeat shows that during the shutdown, there is no data.

### Expected Behavior

Send an alert about the unavailability.

### Steps To Reproduce

In Service Monitor -> WEBSITES
Add a monitor for any website that may cause a TIME OUT,
Add a monitor for another normal website, for me, SSL is off, interval is 120s, and all settings in Advanced Settings are not modified.

### Environment

```markdown
HertzBeat version(s): v1.2.2
Ubuntu 22.04 LTS x86_64
installed via binary and ./bin/startup.sh

java --version
openjdk 19.0.1 2022-10-18
OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 19.0.1+10-Ubuntu-1ubuntu122.04)
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (build 19.0.1+10-Ubuntu-1ubuntu122.04, mixed mode, sharing)
```


### Debug logs

[startup.log](https://github.com/dromara/hertzbeat/files/10264218/startup.log)


### Anything else?

Notice that the first exception appears after the first github.com time out


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/83632110/208568035-b07558e2-087a-4641-905f-c520217d5036.mp4

----    
hi thanks for the feedback
> The ping alarm can only be triggered based on the ping time consumption, and the ping collection failure and abnormal conditions do not have the ping time consumption. An alarm cannot be triggered, but finding ping exceptions and timeouts is the purpose of ping detection. It is a more serious problem than the longer ping time

Here, if the ping collection is abnormal, China Unicom fails or times out, the system will have an [availability alarm], which will be available for all monitoring types, and it is built-in, and there is no need to set a threshold to trigger it. [Availability alarm] For monitoring, when the collection of availability indicators with a priority of 0 fails, it will be automatically issued, and the corresponding monitoring status will also change

title: [Question] How would I add monitor support for ETCD?
body:
### Question

Any template that I can create to support ETCD? How can I start this action,thanks.

title: NA
body:
Hi etcd has no adaptation support yet, you can use [custom monitoring](https://hertzbeat.com/docs/advanced/extend-point) to write yml to monitor etcd due etcd exposes promethues protocol metrics. Like [apache iotdb monitor](https://github.com/dromara/hertzbeat/blob/master/manager/src/main/resources/define/app/app-iotdb.yml) or [apache shenyu montior](https://github.com/dromara/hertzbeat/blob/master/manager/src/main/resources/define/app/app-shenyu.yml).  
Also, etcd is in roadmap we will support as soon as possible.

title: [BUG] Front-end displayï¼ŒAlarm notification keeps spinning in circles occasionally
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Current Behavior

Click the notification button, the pop-up window keeps spinning for more than a minute, this happens occasionally. But the request response is done in milliseconds. And another request is sent after I close the popup.

Immediately display the content after clicking, do not keep spinning.

### Steps To Reproduce

Repeatedly click the notification button.

### Environment

```markdown
HertzBeat version(1.1.1):
```

_No response_

_No response_

### Description

jpa auto ddl works great when adding new tables or adding new columns, but cannot do fine-grained management of the database, such as dropping columns, dropping indexes, dropping checks, etc.
Flyway can solve this problem very well.

title: Alert Notify
body:
### Question

Hi Guys,

I just installed hertzbeat on my server using docker,refer to this link : https://techviewleo.com/monitor-linux-systems-using-hertzbeat/

I can access the WEB UI,however there is some question i need to ask

1. I can add my alert notify to telegram because there is option to telegram,you can refer to the screenshot below :
   https://postimg.cc/ts949bY2
   
2. If i want to monitor another server and how to install an agent to the server target ?

Please Advice

Thanks in advance

title: NA
body:
Hi, thanks for using.  The `telegram notify` has supported but not publish in latest version. It will supported in next version v1.2.5 few days later.  
> 2. If i want to monitor another server and how to install an agent to the server target ?   

hertzbeat is agentless. you can monitor linux ubuntu... directly by configing `ip port ssh params` with WEB UI.

I understand, I installed the ssh service in the docker container of Hertzbeat according to the idea of â€‹â€‹freeing the public key, generated a key pair, and wrote the public key into the target host. The test container access to the target host has been password-free, but the system still reports an error .
After a brief look at the corresponding position of the code, sshProtocol.getPublicKey() does not seem to be assigned a value. Is this a bug?

title: [Question] Alert Settings
body:
### Question

Hi Guys,

Thanks for your latest update for docker image.

I just setup this hertzbeat on our server  using docker(docker run -d -p 1157:1157 --name hertzbeat tancloud/hertzbeat),
we have added Ubuntu Linux(OS Monitor) the metrics should be fine,because i can see from the dashboard that this monitoring system could collect all the metrics from the target server.

I setup the alert notify to telegram and its successfully send the test alert and i also setup the alert setting,you can refer to the screenshot below :
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63686253/217169377-9bef08e1-b31a-468c-9ab7-80e6aec2cbd9.png)

fyi, current usage for "/" (root) is 65 % already but its not send any alert.

Please Advice

Thanks in advance

title: NA
body: Hi, if you have added Ubuntu Linux(OS Monitor) by **Ubuntu Linux**, the alert setting metric target should be `Ubuntu Linux` not `Linux`.

title: NA
body:
Hi @tomsun28,

Thanks for your reply.

I made it already,

Regarding the notification rule,is it possible to send the notification only once per policy so it wont send the same notification repeatedly

Please Advice

Thanks in advance

title: NA
body:
> Regarding the notification rule,is it possible to send the notification only once per policy so it wont send the same notification repeatedly

Hi, the notification policy are each independent, can not send only once per policy.  

If you worry about too many same alerts. We will support alarm grouping and alarm silence some time later

hi has you modify application.yml config `warehouse.store.memory` or `warehouse.store.redis` ? 

```
warehouse:
  store:
    redis:
      enabled: false
      host: 127.0.0.1
      port: 6379
      password: 123456
    memory:
      enabled: true
      init-size: 1024
```

title: NA
body:
> Bot detected the issue body's language is not English, translate it automatically. ğŸ‘¯ğŸ‘­ğŸ»ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ§‘ğŸ‘«ğŸ§‘ğŸ¿â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ§‘ğŸ»ğŸ‘©ğŸ¾â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ‘¨ğŸ¿ğŸ‘¬ğŸ¿         
----    
> The collector module regularly pulls the data of the push module. Is it impossible to solve the application that hertzbeat is deployed on the external network and cannot access the internal network. There should be a client, such as redis_client, which regularly collects redis monitoring data and pushes it to hertzbeat @Ceilzcx @tomsun28

Yes, the client written by the user should be required to push data to the push module.
If the push module is deployed on the external network, the gateway only needs to release the egress traffic. If the push module is on the intranet, an ingress traffic needs to be released so that the collect module can access the push module
@gcdd1993

> > > The collector module regularly pulls the data of the push module. Is it impossible to solve the application that hertzbeat is deployed on the external network and cannot access the internal network. If the push module is deployed on the external network, the gateway only needs to release the egress traffic. If the push module is on the internal network, an ingress traffic needs to be released so that the collect module can access the push module @gcdd1993
>
> A subsequent problem is how to reuse the existing collect module, and how to manage the configuration of the client (deliver the configuration to the client). Many collection protocols may be available with [pf4j](https://github.com /pf4j/pf4j) Refactor a wave

Reuse should be possible. The monitorId generated in step 1 is for reuse. The original data of the collector module is placed in a Map, and the key is monitorId. At that time, I discussed with Tom how to effectively let users Obtain this monitorId, and at the same time use it as a key-like effect of push, query whether the monitorId is valid (in the database), and ensure that the data uploaded by the user is correct

----    
> @tomsun28 One question still needs to be considered, whether push needs to be deployed separately, because prometheus is through an exporter, it is normal for pushgateway to be a single module, and our push function can actually be merged. Consider the benefits of separate deployment, after all, separate deployment and configuration increase user operations

In our first version, push can be made into a module, and it will not be deployed separately for the time being. It is in the form of all in one like other modules. Separate deployment I think that in the future cluster environment, multi-collectors and PUSH receivers can support multi-process separate deployment. I feel that this is not necessary at present, and separate deployment increases the cost of user configuration operations.

æ³¨é‡Šå¹¶ä¸”ç¿»è¯‘ç›‘æ§YMLå®šä¹‰æ–‡ä»¶å†…å®¹ï¼Œéœ€æ”¯æŒè‹±æ–‡å’Œä¸­æ–‡ï¼Œè¯·æ³¨æ„æ ¼å¼å¯¹é½ã€‚  
æ³¨é‡Šå¹¶ä¸”ç¿»è¯‘å†…å®¹éœ€è¦åˆ°YMLæ–‡ä»¶é‡Œé¢çš„ä¸€ä¸ªmetricsæŒ‡æ ‡ç»„å®šä¹‰ï¼Œå…¶ä½™metricså†…å®¹æ— éœ€æ³¨é‡Šç¿»è¯‘ï¼Œå‚è€ƒå¦‚ä¸‹ `#` å†…å®¹ã€‚

eg:  [app-a_example.yml](https://github.com/dromara/hertzbeat/blob/master/manager/src/main/resources/define/app-a_example.yml) 
 
```
# Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one or more

# The monitoring type categoryï¼šservice-application service monitoring db-database monitoring custom-custom monitoring os-operating system monitoring
# ç›‘æ§ç±»å‹æ‰€å±ç±»åˆ«ï¼šservice-åº”ç”¨æœåŠ¡ç›‘æ§ db-æ•°æ®åº“ç›‘æ§ custom-è‡ªå®šä¹‰ç›‘æ§ os-æ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿç›‘æ§ cn-äº‘åŸç”Ÿcloud native network-ç½‘ç»œç›‘æ§
category: custom
# The monitoring type eg: linux windows tomcat mysql aws...
# ç›‘æ§ç±»å‹ eg: linux windows tomcat mysql aws...
app: a_example
# The monitoring i18n name
# ç›‘æ§ç±»å‹å›½é™…åŒ–åç§°
name:
  zh-CN: æ¨¡æ‹Ÿåº”ç”¨
  en-US: EXAMPLE APP
# ç›‘æ§æ‰€éœ€è¾“å…¥å‚æ•°å®šä¹‰(æ ¹æ®å®šä¹‰æ¸²æŸ“é¡µé¢UI)
# Input params define for monitoring(render web ui by the definition)
params:
  # field-param field key
  # field-å˜é‡å­—æ®µæ ‡è¯†ç¬¦
  - field: host
    # name-param field display i18n name
    # name-å‚æ•°å­—æ®µæ˜¾ç¤ºåç§°
    name:
      zh-CN: ä¸»æœºHost
      en-US: Host
    # type-param field type(most mapping the html input type)
    # type-å­—æ®µç±»å‹,æ ·å¼(å¤§éƒ¨åˆ†æ˜ å°„inputæ ‡ç­¾typeå±æ€§)
    type: host
    # required-true or false
    # required-æ˜¯å¦æ˜¯å¿…è¾“é¡¹ true-å¿…å¡« false-å¯é€‰
    required: true
  # field-param field key
  # field-å˜é‡å­—æ®µæ ‡è¯†ç¬¦
  - field: port
    # name-param field display i18n name
    # name-å‚æ•°å­—æ®µæ˜¾ç¤ºåç§°
    name:
      zh-CN: ç«¯å£
      en-US: Port
    # type-param field type(most mapping the html input type)
    # type-å­—æ®µç±»å‹,æ ·å¼(å¤§éƒ¨åˆ†æ˜ å°„inputæ ‡ç­¾typeå±æ€§)
    type: number
    # when type is number, range is required
    # å½“typeä¸ºnumberæ—¶,ç”¨rangeè¡¨ç¤ºèŒƒå›´
    range: '[0,65535]'
    # required-true or false
    # required-æ˜¯å¦æ˜¯å¿…è¾“é¡¹ true-å¿…å¡« false-å¯é€‰
    required: true
    # default value
    # é»˜è®¤å€¼
    defaultValue: 80
    # å‚æ•°è¾“å…¥æ¡†æç¤ºä¿¡æ¯
    # param field input placeholder
    placeholder: 'è¯·è¾“å…¥ç«¯å£'
  # field-param field key
  # field-å˜é‡å­—æ®µæ ‡è¯†ç¬¦
  - field: username
    # name-param field display i18n name
    # name-å‚æ•°å­—æ®µæ˜¾ç¤ºåç§°
    name:
      zh-CN: ç”¨æˆ·å
      en-US: Username
    # type-param field type(most mapping the html input type)
    # type-å­—æ®µç±»å‹,æ ·å¼(å¤§éƒ¨åˆ†æ˜ å°„inputæ ‡ç­¾typeå±æ€§)
    type: text
    # when type is text, use limit to limit string length
    # å½“typeä¸ºtextæ—¶,ç”¨limitè¡¨ç¤ºå­—ç¬¦ä¸²é™åˆ¶å¤§å°
    limit: 20
    # required-true or false
    # required-æ˜¯å¦æ˜¯å¿…è¾“é¡¹ true-å¿…å¡« false-å¯é€‰
    required: false
    # hide param-true or false
    # æ˜¯å¦éšè—å­—æ®µ true or false
    hide: true
  # field-param field key
  # field-å˜é‡å­—æ®µæ ‡è¯†ç¬¦
  - field: password
    # name-param field display i18n name
    # name-å‚æ•°å­—æ®µæ˜¾ç¤ºåç§°
    name:
      zh-CN: ç”¨æˆ·å¯†ç 
      en-US: Password
    # type-param field type(most mapping the html input tag)
    # type-å­—æ®µç±»å‹,æ ·å¼(å¤§éƒ¨åˆ†æ˜ å°„inputæ ‡ç­¾typeå±æ€§)
    type: password
    # required-true or false
    # required-æ˜¯å¦æ˜¯å¿…è¾“é¡¹ true-å¿…å¡« false-å¯é€‰
    required: false
    # hide param-true or false
    # æ˜¯å¦éšè—å­—æ®µ true or false
    hide: true
  # field-param field key
  # field-å˜é‡å­—æ®µæ ‡è¯†ç¬¦
  - field: ssl
    # name-param field display i18n name
    # name-å‚æ•°å­—æ®µæ˜¾ç¤ºåç§°
    name:
      zh-CN: å¯åŠ¨SSL
      en-US: SSL
    # type-param field type(boolean mapping the html switch tag)
    # type-å½“typeä¸ºbooleanæ—¶,å‰ç«¯ç”¨switchå±•ç¤ºå¼€å…³
    type: boolean
    # required-true or false
    # required-æ˜¯å¦æ˜¯å¿…è¾“é¡¹ true-å¿…å¡« false-å¯é€‰
    required: false
  # field-param field key
  # field-å˜é‡å­—æ®µæ ‡è¯†ç¬¦
  - field: method
    # name-param field display i18n name
    # name-å‚æ•°å­—æ®µæ˜¾ç¤ºåç§°
    name:
      zh-CN: è¯·æ±‚æ–¹å¼
      en-US: Method
    # type-param field type(radio mapping the html radio tag)
    # type-å½“typeä¸ºradioæ—¶,å‰ç«¯ç”¨radioå±•ç¤ºå¼€å…³
    type: radio
    # required-true or false
    # required-æ˜¯å¦æ˜¯å¿…è¾“é¡¹ true-å¿…å¡« false-å¯é€‰
    required: true
    # when type is radio checkbox, use option to show optional values {name1:value1,name2:value2}
    # å½“typeä¸ºradioå•é€‰æ¡†, checkboxå¤é€‰æ¡†æ—¶, optionè¡¨ç¤ºå¯é€‰é¡¹å€¼åˆ—è¡¨ {name1:value1,name2:value2}
    options:
      - label: GET
        value: GET
      - label: POST
        value: POST
      - label: PUT
        value: PUT
      - label: DELETE
        value: DELETE
  # field-param field key
  # field-å˜é‡å­—æ®µæ ‡è¯†ç¬¦
  - field: headers
    # name-param field display i18n name
    # name-å‚æ•°å­—æ®µæ˜¾ç¤ºåç§°
    name:
      zh-CN: è¯·æ±‚Headers
      en-US: Headers
    # type-param field type(key-value mapping the html key-value input tags)
    # type-å­—æ®µç±»å‹(key-valueæ˜ å°„ä¸ºå‰ç«¯key-valueçš„åŒinputæ ¼å¼æ¸²æŸ“)
    type: key-value
    # required-true or false
    # required-æ˜¯å¦æ˜¯å¿…è¾“é¡¹ true-å¿…å¡« false-å¯é€‰
    required: false
    # when type is key-value, use keyAlias to config key alias name
    # å½“å­—æ®µç±»å‹ä¸ºkey-valueæ—¶, ä½¿ç”¨keyAliasé…ç½®keyçš„å±•ç¤ºåˆ«å
    keyAlias: Header Name
    # when type is key-value, use valueAlias to config value alias name
    # å½“å­—æ®µç±»å‹ä¸ºkey-valueæ—¶, ä½¿ç”¨valueAliasé…ç½®valueçš„å±•ç¤ºåˆ«å
    valueAlias: Header Value
# collect metrics config list
# é‡‡é›†æŒ‡æ ‡ç»„é…ç½®åˆ—è¡¨
metrics:
  # metrics - cpu
  # ç›‘æ§æŒ‡æ ‡ç»„ - cpu
  - name: cpu
    # metrics group scheduling priority(0->127)->(high->low), metrics with the same priority will be scheduled in parallel
    # priority 0's metrics group is availability metrics, it will be scheduled first, only availability metrics collect success will the scheduling continue
    # æŒ‡æ ‡ç»„è°ƒåº¦ä¼˜å…ˆçº§(0->127)->(ä¼˜å…ˆçº§é«˜->ä½) ä¼˜å…ˆçº§ä½çš„æŒ‡æ ‡ç»„ä¼šç­‰ä¼˜å…ˆçº§é«˜çš„æŒ‡æ ‡ç»„é‡‡é›†å®Œæˆåæ‰ä¼šè¢«è°ƒåº¦, ç›¸åŒä¼˜å…ˆçº§çš„æŒ‡æ ‡ç»„ä¼šå¹¶è¡Œè°ƒåº¦é‡‡é›†
    # ä¼˜å…ˆçº§ä¸º0çš„æŒ‡æ ‡ç»„ä¸ºå¯ç”¨æ€§æŒ‡æ ‡ç»„,å³å®ƒä¼šè¢«é¦–å…ˆè°ƒåº¦,é‡‡é›†æˆåŠŸæ‰ä¼šç»§ç»­è°ƒåº¦å…¶å®ƒæŒ‡æ ‡ç»„,é‡‡é›†å¤±è´¥åˆ™ä¸­æ–­è°ƒåº¦
    priority: 0
    # collect metrics content
    # å…·ä½“ç›‘æ§æŒ‡æ ‡åˆ—è¡¨
    fields:
      # field-metric name, type-metric type(0-number,1-string), unit-metric unit('%','ms','MB'), instance-if is metrics group unique identifier
      # field-æŒ‡æ ‡åç§°, type-æŒ‡æ ‡ç±»å‹(0-numberæ•°å­—,1-stringå­—ç¬¦ä¸²), unit-æŒ‡æ ‡å•ä½('%','ms','MB'), instance-æ˜¯å¦æ˜¯æŒ‡æ ‡é›†åˆå”¯ä¸€æ ‡è¯†ç¬¦å­—æ®µ
      - field: hostname
        type: 1
        instance: true
      - field: usage
        type: 0
        unit: '%'
      - field: cores
        type: 0
      - field: waitTime
        type: 0
        unit: s
    # (optional)metrics field alias name, it is used as an alias field to map and convert the collected data and metrics field
    # (å¯é€‰)ç›‘æ§æŒ‡æ ‡åˆ«å, åšä¸ºä¸­é—´å­—æ®µä¸é‡‡é›†æ•°æ®å­—æ®µå’ŒæŒ‡æ ‡å­—æ®µæ˜ å°„è½¬æ¢
    aliasFields:
      - hostname
      - core1
      - core2
      - usage
      - allTime
      - runningTime
    # mapping and conversion expressions, use these and aliasField above to calculate metrics value
    # (å¯é€‰)æŒ‡æ ‡æ˜ å°„è½¬æ¢è®¡ç®—è¡¨è¾¾å¼,ä¸ä¸Šé¢çš„åˆ«åä¸€èµ·ä½œç”¨,è®¡ç®—å‡ºæœ€ç»ˆéœ€è¦çš„æŒ‡æ ‡å€¼
    # eg: cores=core1+core2, usage=usage, waitTime=allTime-runningTime
    calculates:
      - hostname=hostname
      - cores=core1+core2
      - usage=usage
      - waitTime=allTime-runningTime
    # the protocol used for monitoring, eg: sql, ssh, http, telnet, wmi, snmp, sdk
    protocol: http
    # the config content when protocol is http
    http:
      # http host: ipv4 ipv6 domain
      host: ^_^host^_^
      # http port
      port: ^_^port^_^
      # http url
      url: /metrics/cpu
      # http method: GET POST PUT DELETE PATCH
      method: GET
      # if enabled https
      ssl: false
      # http request header content
      headers:
        ^_^headers^_^: ^_^headers^_^
      # http request params
      params:
        param1: param1
        param2: param2
      # http auth
      authorization:
        # http auth type: Basic Auth, Digest Auth, Bearer Token
        type: Basic Auth
        basicAuthUsername: ^_^username^_^
        basicAuthPassword: ^_^password^_^
      # http response data parse type: default-hertzbeat rule, jsonpath-jsonpath script, website-for website monitoring, prometheus-prometheus exporter rule
      # http å“åº”æ•°æ®è§£ææ–¹å¼: default-ç³»ç»Ÿè§„åˆ™, jsonPath-jsonPathè„šæœ¬, website-ç½‘ç«™å¯ç”¨æ€§æŒ‡æ ‡ç›‘æ§, prometheus-Prometheusæ•°æ®è§„åˆ™
      parseType: jsonPath
      parseScript: '$'

  - name: memory
    priority: 1
    fields:
      - field: hostname
        type: 1
        instance: true
      - field: total
        type: 0
        unit: kb
      - field: usage
        type: 0
        unit: '%'
      - field: speed
        type: 0
    protocol: http
    http:
      host: ^_^host^_^
      port: ^_^port^_^
      url: /metrics/memory
      method: GET
      headers:
        apiVersion: v1
      params:
        param1: param1
        param2: param2
      authorization:
        type: Basic Auth
        basicAuthUsername: ^_^username^_^
        basicAuthPassword: ^_^password^_^
      parseType: default

```

Problem: Due to network reasons, some active monitoring, only one timeout will give an alarm

Risk: Of course, increasing the number of retries will increase the service load, which can also be controlled by the user

--"Increase the retry interval

title: NA
body: @tomsun28 I tried searching for a fix for this problem, I cant seem to find something. Can you help me a bit?

title: NA
body:
> @tomsun28 I tried searching for a fix for this problem, I cant seem to find something. Can you help me a bit?

@ArslanYM hi, yes i can. This feature need to support a new monitor type - udp port monitoring. 
I think we should do it in a few steps.
- Define a new monitoring protocol - udp protocol.  Refer to `telnet protocol` https://github.com/dromara/hertzbeat/blob/master/common/src/main/java/com/usthe/common/entity/job/protocol/TelnetProtocol.java 
- Implment udp protocol collect code use java udp socket. Refer to `telnet collect impl` https://github.com/dromara/hertzbeat/blob/master/collector/src/main/java/com/usthe/collector/collect/telnet/TelnetCollectImpl.java 
- Use this protocol to define udp monitor type yml. Refer to `telnet monitor type define yml` https://github.com/dromara/hertzbeat/blob/master/manager/src/main/resources/define/app-port.yml

All done. After this we can test our new monitoring type.

title: [Task] <support using `Huawei Cloud OBS` to store custom define yml file>
body:
### Description

### Huawei Cloud & HertzBeat 's Feature Task 

> Currently, our custom monitoring define YML files are stored in the local directory, so we need to mount the persistence when docker start, or run the k8s stateful application, and it is easy to lose data. 

So this feature is supporting using `Huawei Cloud OBS` to store custom define yml file to solve yml file store problem.

refer doc https://support.huaweicloud.com/intl/zh-cn/sdk-java-devg-obs/obs_21_0001.html 
api doc https://console.huaweicloud.com/apiexplorer/#/openapi/OBS/doc

category: mid

params:

    # type-param field type(most mapping the html input type)

    type: number

    range: '[0,65535]'

    required: true

    defaultValue: 8848

# collect metrics config list

metrics:
  # metrics - system
  # ç›‘æ§æŒ‡æ ‡ç»„ - system
  - name: system
    # metrics group scheduling priority(0->127)->(high->low), metrics with the same priority will be scheduled in parallel
    # priority 0's metrics group is availability metrics, it will be scheduled first, only availability metrics collect success will the scheduling continue
    # æŒ‡æ ‡ç»„è°ƒåº¦ä¼˜å…ˆçº§(0->127)->(ä¼˜å…ˆçº§é«˜->ä½) ä¼˜å…ˆçº§ä½çš„æŒ‡æ ‡ç»„ä¼šç­‰ä¼˜å…ˆçº§é«˜çš„æŒ‡æ ‡ç»„é‡‡é›†å®Œæˆåæ‰ä¼šè¢«è°ƒåº¦, ç›¸åŒä¼˜å…ˆçº§çš„æŒ‡æ ‡ç»„ä¼šå¹¶è¡Œè°ƒåº¦é‡‡é›†
    # ä¼˜å…ˆçº§ä¸º0çš„æŒ‡æ ‡ç»„ä¸ºå¯ç”¨æ€§æŒ‡æ ‡ç»„,å³å®ƒä¼šè¢«é¦–å…ˆè°ƒåº¦,é‡‡é›†æˆåŠŸæ‰ä¼šç»§ç»­è°ƒåº¦å…¶å®ƒæŒ‡æ ‡ç»„,é‡‡é›†å¤±è´¥åˆ™ä¸­æ–­è°ƒåº¦
    priority: 0
    # collect metrics content
    # å…·ä½“ç›‘æ§æŒ‡æ ‡åˆ—è¡¨
    fields:

      # field-æŒ‡æ ‡åç§°, type-æŒ‡æ ‡ç±»å‹(0-numberæ•°å­—,1-stringå­—ç¬¦ä¸²), unit-æŒ‡æ ‡å•ä½('%','ms','MB'), instance-æ˜¯å¦æ˜¯æŒ‡æ ‡é›†åˆå”¯ä¸€æ ‡è¯†ç¬¦å­—æ®µ
      - field: system_cpu_usage

      - field: system_average_load

      - field: system_memory_usage

    # (optional)metrics field alias name, it is used as an alias field to map and convert the collected data and metrics field
    # (å¯é€‰)ç›‘æ§æŒ‡æ ‡åˆ«å, åšä¸ºä¸­é—´å­—æ®µä¸é‡‡é›†æ•°æ®å­—æ®µå’ŒæŒ‡æ ‡å­—æ®µæ˜ å°„è½¬æ¢
    aliasFields:

    # eg: cores=core1+core2, usage=usage, waitTime=allTime-runningTime
    calculates:

      - system_memory_usage=mem * 100
    # the protocol used for monitoring, eg: sql, ssh, http, telnet, wmi, snmp, sdk
    # ç›‘æ§ä½¿ç”¨åè®®, ä¾‹å¦‚: sql, ssh, http, telnet, wmi, snmp, sdk
    protocol: http
    # the config content when protocol is http
    # å½“ä½¿ç”¨httpåè®®æ—¶çš„é…ç½®å†…å®¹
    http:
        # http host: ipv4 ipv6 domain

        # http method: GET POST PUT DELETE PATCH
        # http è¯·æ±‚æ–¹æ³•: GET POST PUT DELETE PATCH

        # http response data parse type: default-hertzbeat rule, jsonpath-jsonpath script, website-for website monitoring, prometheus-prometheus exporter rule
        # http å“åº”æ•°æ®è§£ææ–¹å¼: default-ç³»ç»Ÿè§„åˆ™, jsonPath-jsonPathè„šæœ¬, website-ç½‘ç«™å¯ç”¨æ€§æŒ‡æ ‡ç›‘æ§, prometheus-Prometheusæ•°æ®è§„åˆ™
        parseType: jsonPath
        parseScript: $.data

  - name: jvm_gc_count
    priority: 1

### Question

Background: Intranet monitoring is required for the project. At present, intranet data can pass through the border to the Internet, that is, the Internet can receive monitoring alarms, but it cannot remotely access the intranet server.
Requirements: When monitoring alarms, connect to the target server and send a specified command to restart the service, avoiding minor problems to be dealt with on-site late at night.

title: SQL server driver connection error [BUG] <title>
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Current Behavior

The default driver is jdk 8,
I replaced the JDK 11 and  error during startup
ERRORï¼š
[root@localhost logs]# cat localhost.localdomain70635-2023-05-04-error.0.log
2023-05-04 16:03:08.246 [main] ERROR com.usthe.collector.collect.database.JdbcSpiLoader Line:47  - load jdbc error: com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerDriver
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerDriver
        at java.base/jdk.internal.loader.BuiltinClassLoader.loadClass(BuiltinClassLoader.java:583)
        at java.base/jdk.internal.loader.ClassLoaders$AppClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoaders.java:178)
        at java.base/java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:521)
        at java.base/java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method)
        at java.base/java.lang.Class.forName(Class.java:315)
        at com.usthe.collector.collect.database.JdbcSpiLoader.run(JdbcSpiLoader.java:42)
        at org.springframework.boot.SpringApplication.callRunner(SpringApplication.java:771)
        at org.springframework.boot.SpringApplication.callRunners(SpringApplication.java:755)
        at org.springframework.boot.SpringApplication.run(SpringApplication.java:315)
        at org.springframework.boot.SpringApplication.run(SpringApplication.java:1306)
        at org.springframework.boot.SpringApplication.run(SpringApplication.java:1295)
        at com.usthe.manager.Manager.main(Manager.java:40)
2023-05-04 16:03:09.444 [scheduling-1] ERROR com.usthe.warehouse.store.HistoryJpaDatabaseDataStorage Line:71  - expiredDataCleaner database error: No EntityManager with actual transaction available for current thread - cannot reliably process 'remove' call; nested exception is javax.persistence.TransactionRequiredException: No EntityManager with actual transaction available for current thread - cannot reliably process 'remove' call.


### Expected Behavior

./startup.sh

### Steps To Reproduce

1,download [Microsoft JDBC Driver 12.2 for SQL Server (tar.gz)]
https://learn.microsoft.com/zh-cn/sql/connect/jdbc/download-microsoft-jdbc-driver-for-sql-server?view=sql-server-ver16

2,change driver
cd /opt/hertzbeat/lib
rm mssql-jdbc-10.2.1.jre8.jar
mv mssql-jdbc-12.2.0.jre11.jar /opt/hertzbeat/lib
chmod 775 mssql-jdbc-12.2.0.jre11.jar

3,startup
cd /opt/hertzbeat/bin
./startup.sh

### Environment

```markdown
HertzBeat version(s):1.3.0
```

        at org.springframework.boot.SpringApplication.callRunner(SpringApplication.java:771)

----    
Hello, this is not a bug, when modifying the jar file, since the previously packaged file is mssql-jdbc-10.2.1.jre8.jar instead of mssql-jdbc-12.2.0.jre11.jar, it cannot find this Depends, you need to modify the hertzbeat/hertzbeat.jar file, use the decompression software to directly modify the META-INF/MANIFEST.MF file, search for mssql-jdbc-10.2.1.jre8.jar and replace it with mssql-jdbc-12.2.0 After running .jre11.jar, it will work. I tested it works fine.

body:
### Question

å­˜åœ¨çš„ç–‘é—®ï¼š
1. `zk`çš„ç›‘æ§æ˜¯åŸºäº`nc`å‘½ä»¤æ¥å®ç°çš„ï¼Œé‚£ä¸ºä»€ä¹ˆè¿˜ä¼šéœ€è¦åŸºäº`ssh`åè®®ï¼Ÿ
2. ç°åœ¨çš„å†…ç½®`zk`ç›‘æ§æ¨¡æ¿`app-zookeeper.yml`ï¼Œåœ¨åŸºäº`ssh`åè®®çš„åŸºç¡€ä¸Šï¼Œæ‰§è¡Œçš„è¯¸å¦‚`echo mntr | nc 121.40.113.44 2181`å‘½ä»¤ï¼Œæ˜¯ä¸æ­£ç¡®çš„ï¼Œå¦‚æœéœ€è¦ç›‘æ§å¤šå°`zk`ï¼Œæ¯ä¸ªéƒ½éœ€è¦æ”¹å¯¹åº”çš„`ipåœ°å€`ï¼Œä¹Ÿå°±æ˜¯è¯´éœ€è¦é‡æ–°è‡ªå®šä¹‰ç›‘æ§æ¥å®ç°ã€‚ä¸ºä½•ä¸ç›´æ¥é€šè¿‡å˜é‡çš„å½¢å¼æ§åˆ¶å³å¯ï¼Ÿ

æˆ‘çš„ä¸ªäººè€ƒè™‘ï¼Œæ˜¯å¦åº”è¯¥ç›´æ¥æ”¯æŒ`nc`åè®®ï¼Œä¸éœ€è¦`over ssh`ä¼šæ›´åˆç†ä¸€äº›ï¼Ÿ

title: NA
body:
> Bot detected the issue body's language is not English, translate it automatically. ğŸ‘¯ğŸ‘­ğŸ»ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ§‘ğŸ‘«ğŸ§‘ğŸ¿â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ§‘ğŸ»ğŸ‘©ğŸ¾â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ‘¨ğŸ¿ğŸ‘¬ğŸ¿         
----    
### Question

Existing doubts:
1. The monitoring of `zk` is implemented based on the `nc` command, so why is it still based on the `ssh` protocol?
2. The current built-in `zk` monitoring template `app-zookeeper.yml`, based on the `ssh` protocol, executes commands such as `echo mntr | nc 121.40.113.44 2181`, which is incorrect. If necessary To monitor multiple `zk`, each needs to change the corresponding `ip address`, that is to say, it needs to re-customize the monitoring to achieve. Why not directly control it in the form of variables?

In my personal consideration, should the `nc` protocol be directly supported, and it would be more reasonable not to require `over ssh`?

title: NA
body:
> Bot detected the issue body's language is not English, translate it automatically. ğŸ‘¯ğŸ‘­ğŸ»ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ§‘ğŸ‘«ğŸ§‘ğŸ¿â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ§‘ğŸ»ğŸ‘©ğŸ¾â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ‘¨ğŸ¿ğŸ‘¬ğŸ¿         
----    
After my analysis and experiments, the monitoring of `zookeeper` can be based on `telnet` to achieve the same effect as the `nc` command. In order not to increase the complexity of the system, I extended the `telnet` protocol in the project, which can support sending commands and parsing the response results after `telnet` reaches the specified port. On this basis, `zookeeper` monitoring can be realized without `ssh` to the corresponding server. I have submitted `PR` for specific implementation, see #957

----    
### Question

Theoretically speaking, the monitoring system mainly operates in the intranet environment, and in some enterprises, there will be internal domain names. In less rigorous cases, some common characters (such as underscore) may be used as internal domain names. This will result in inability to access monitoring. Personally, I think you can consider relaxing some common character restrictions.

@jvhuaxia current not support. weclome to update collecting metrics code to implement this.

title: NA
body:
Design Http Collect YML Format.
Add successCode field, the successCode means what http response status code we consider it collect success. 

```
    http:
      host: ^_^host^_^
      port: ^_^port^_^
      url: ^_^base_path^_^/health
      method: GET
      ssl: ^_^ssl^_^
      successCode: [200, 503]
      parseType: default
```

title: NA
body: maybe I can work on this, pls asign to me

title: NA
body:
hi welcome @l646505418 , i think we should update the http protocol file https://github.com/dromara/hertzbeat/blob/master/common/src/main/java/org/dromara/hertzbeat/common/entity/job/protocol/HttpProtocol.java

Add Field. 
```

    /**
     * http success status code. default 200
     * successCode means what http response status code we consider it collect success.
     */
    private List<Integer> successCode = List.of(200);
```
And update http collecting implment.  https://github.com/dromara/hertzbeat/blob/master/collector/src/main/java/org/dromara/hertzbeat/collector/collect/http/HttpCollectImpl.java#L118

hi This is intentionally limited. If you do not limit the amount of index data stored in the H2 database, it is easy to crash due to database performance problems. Therefore, our documents recommend that you use the configuration time series database to store indicator data, and there is no limit to the time series database.

But for mysql, with the current historical table structure, less than one million pieces of data should not be enough to constitute a performance problem. The limit of 20000 is still a bit too small.
The suggestion is that it can be configured, and the risk is indicated in the configuration item, so that users can change it carefully.

body:
> Bot detected the issue body's language is not English, translate it automatically. ğŸ‘¯ğŸ‘­ğŸ»ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ§‘ğŸ‘«ğŸ§‘ğŸ¿â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ§‘ğŸ»ğŸ‘©ğŸ¾â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ‘¨ğŸ¿ğŸ‘¬ğŸ¿         
----    
The 90s trigger time can be controlled by configuring the monitoring acquisition period. When monitoring is unavailable, there will be no data, and an availability monitoring alarm will be issued. But it is still not possible to judge the threshold value of empty data. Let's think about how to realize this. In theory, it can be realized by implementing a function that configures the threshold expression to judge whether it is empty.

----    
Hi @tomsun28, I see the code as if the header of the request only has the JWT token, but when the token expires, even the userId cannot be parsed out, so the expired token data cannot be deleted in the db. My idea is to recreate a token pojo on the backend and assign it an id. When the token is passed on the front end, the id can also be passed over for the purpose of adding, modifying and checking the database. I wonder if this is feasible?

My idea is to recreate a token pojo on the backend and assign it an id. When the token is passed on the front end, the id can also be passed over for the purpose of adding, modifying and checking the database. I wonder if this is feasible?

Hi, do you mean that a token and id need to be passed during authentication, so that it cannot comply with the openapi authentication token specification. You can see if this works, you can design a data table of issued tokens, which contains fields token, issuance time and expiration time, etc. The deletion of the token issued by the user should be manually deleted by the user. Even if the token expires, you can refer to the token management api of GitHub Gitee.

> Does it mean that the token used by the user to log in is different from the token obtained by the user calling generateToken? I think it is feasible, hhh and is it possible to limit the number of tokens issued by the user to prevent him from issuing them insanely?

Yes, these two can be different APIs, because the token generated by the user can set parameters such as expiration time, we can provide a set of APIs for user-defined token management. I feel that the number of generated should be limited, so that one is safer, and we don't need to do paging, we can limit about 8 or 10.

Discussion in doubt:
1. Where is the collected data stored?
    Main hz (the collector needs to synchronize the data to the main hz after each collection, and needs to deal with various packet loss and other problems, and the bandwidth usage is high)
    The collector module stores itself (the collector of the intranet cannot be realized, and it can be queried through the external network)
2. How does hz configure the address of the collector module?
    configuration file
    database
3. Heartbeat mechanism, does the collector send a heartbeat to hz or does hz send a heartbeat to the collector?
4. How does hz respond to problems such as online, logout, connection failure, and reconnection of the collector module?

title: [Question] How to get in touch regarding a security concern?
body:
### Question

Hello ğŸ‘‹

I found a potential security issue in hertzbeat, how can I get in touch with you in a private way and submit my security report?

Could you add a SECURITY.md file with an e-mail address for me to send further details to? GitHub [recommends](https://docs.github.com/en/code-security/getting-started/adding-a-security-policy-to-your-repository) a security policy to ensure issues are responsibly disclosed, and it would help direct researchers in the future.

---
Your screenshot is completely unconvincing. The root cause of the problem lies in the fact that during the process of storing data into MySQL, there are special characters present in the field values that need to be escaped or encoded properly; otherwise, it will result in writing errors. Specifically, these field values describe SSL certificate information and contain newline characters and double quotation marks. These special symbols must be escaped.

title: NA
body:
The root cause of this issue is that for `$.start-time`,Avitor will treat `$` as a variable and `start-time` is its member variables.
So from my perspective, if this response is returned by offcial API, maybe you can change the parseType, if this response is returned by your designed API, maybe you can change the variables names @tomsun28 @san346596324

title: [Question] support deploy  behind a proxy like nginx ?
body:
### Question

does hertzbeat support deploy behind a proxy like nginx ?  

I tried it, if the contextpath is added, the application cannot be used normally, and the resource paths are all wrong

maybe we can add a server.basePath configuration like kibana?

server.basePath:
Enables you to specify a path to mount Kibana at if you are running behind a proxy. This only affects the URLs generated by Kibana, your proxy is expected to remove the basePath value before forwarding requests to Kibana. This setting cannot end in a slash (/).

title: NA
body:
hi, hertzbeat support deploy behind a proxy like nginx. 

> maybe we can add a server.basePath configuration like kibana?

maybe you can try config the `application.yml` file
```
server:
  port: 1157
  servlet:
    context-path: /demo
```

title: [BUG] When using HTTP get requests, the params configuration parameters cannot interface properly
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Current Behavior

1.When using HTTP get requests, the params configuration parameters cannot interface properly
2.The data obtained by the interface is the same as without passing parameters
3.After investigation, I found that I was using the time format yyyy mm dd hh: mm: ss, which contains spaces. The parameter was already escaped when saving the incoming interface, resulting in the parameter being used in the hertzbeat backend to dock with the escaped data in the interface. Therefore, the parameter is incorrect
![image](https://github.com/dromara/hertzbeat/assets/30828520/0226679a-fdc3-4974-a1c7-c1cd145571f3)


### Expected Behavior

When using parameter docking, the desired interface data can be obtained normally

### Steps To Reproduce

_No response_

### Environment

```markdown
HertzBeat version(s):1.3.1
```


### Debug logs

_No response_

_No response_

> Bot detected the issue body's language is not English, translate it automatically. ğŸ‘¯ğŸ‘­ğŸ»ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ§‘ğŸ‘«ğŸ§‘ğŸ¿â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ§‘ğŸ»ğŸ‘©ğŸ¾â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ‘¨ğŸ¿ğŸ‘¬ğŸ¿         
----    
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Current Behavior

I come across an event as follows:
My directory permission is non-root, but when performing custom monitoring, a .yml monitoring sample file with root permission was created under the define directory, which caused the software to fail to start and an error was reported
![5e4d281e60db41ba40cfcac1fab3463](https://github.com/dromara/hertzbeat/assets/10276100/277959df-8bd3-4869-ae51-b80000040c6d)
After I deleted this file, it still failed to start, and then I found that there was a hidden .yml.swp file, which was also rooted, which made it impossible to start. After deleting, the software returned to normal.

It is recommended that the software can skip files with incorrect permissions and incorrect configurations when starting the software, and then there will be prompts in the log.

### Expected Behavior

It should be skipping files with incorrect permissions.

### Steps To Reproduce

I come across an event as follows:
My directory permission is non-root, but when performing custom monitoring, a .yml monitoring sample file with root permission was created under the define directory, which caused the software to fail to start and an error was reported
![5e4d281e60db41ba40cfcac1fab3463](https://github.com/dromara/hertzbeat/assets/10276100/277959df-8bd3-4869-ae51-b80000040c6d)
After I deleted this file, it still failed to start, and then I found that there was a hidden .yml.swp file, which was also rooted, which made it impossible to start. After deleting, the software returned to normal.

It is recommended that the software can skip files with incorrect permissions and incorrect configurations when starting the software, and then there will be prompts in the log.

### Environment

```markdown
Hertz Beat version(s):v1.3.1
```


### Debug logs

I come across an event as follows:
My directory permission is non-root, but when performing custom monitoring, a .yml monitoring sample file with root permission was created under the define directory, which caused the software to fail to start and an error was reported
![5e4d281e60db41ba40cfcac1fab3463](https://github.com/dromara/hertzbeat/assets/10276100/277959df-8bd3-4869-ae51-b80000040c6d)
After I deleted this file, it still failed to start, and then I found that there was a hidden .yml.swp file, which was also rooted, which made it impossible to start. After deleting, the software returned to normal.

It is recommended that the software can skip files with incorrect permissions and incorrect configurations when starting the software, and then there will be prompts in the log.

### Anything else?

None

> The alarm convergence here is to converge and deduplicate the same repeated alarms within the specified cycle time range. I think you set it to 5 minutes. You can set the time to be larger

For example, if the setting exceeds 15 minutes, it will become as follows, and the recovery in the middle cannot be seen
1:01 Monitoring availability critical alert api monitoring availability alert, code is UN_CONNECTABLE
1:16 Monitoring Availability Warning Alarm Availability Alarm Recovery Notification, monitoring status has returned to normal

It will also cause a problem. If the aggregation time is exceeded, the same alarm will still be sent, and the cycle will continue

3.ä½¿ç”¨å­˜å‚¨ä¿¡æ¯é‡Œé¢çš„ç£ç›˜ä¿¡æ¯å¯¹ç£ç›˜çš„ä½¿ç”¨ç‡è¿›è¡Œç›‘æ§ï¼Œå› ä¸ºå­˜å‚¨ä¿¡æ¯åŒ…å«äº†è™šæ‹Ÿå†…å­˜å’Œç‰©ç†å†…å­˜çš„ä½¿ç”¨ç‡ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ä¼šå‡ºç°è¯¯æŠ¥çš„æƒ…å†µï¼Œåœ¨è®¾ç½®é˜ˆå€¼æ—¶ï¼Œå¯ä»¥é¢å¤–æ·»åŠ ä¸¤æ¡è§„åˆ™æ¥é¿å…è¿™ç§æƒ…å†µï¼š

title: NA
body:
> Bot detected the issue body's language is not English, translate it automatically. ğŸ‘¯ğŸ‘­ğŸ»ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ§‘ğŸ‘«ğŸ§‘ğŸ¿â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ§‘ğŸ»ğŸ‘©ğŸ¾â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ‘¨ğŸ¿ğŸ‘¬ğŸ¿         
----    
1. The problem mentioned in the title is solved, and the disk information can be found in the storage information.

2. Storage information includes not only disk information, but also memory information. One problem encountered during use is that the memory usage rate exceeds 100%. The reason is that the used size of virtual memory is divided by the size of physical memory. Modify the memory-related oid in src/main/resources/define/app-windows.yml to:
`hrMemorySize: 1.3.6.1.2.1.25.2.2.0`
 `hrStorageUsed: 1.3.6.1.2.1.25.2.3.1.6.6`
 `hrStorageAllocationUnits: 1.3.6.1.2.1.25.2.3.1.4.6`
This is the physical memory size and its used size to find its usage.

3. Use the disk information in the storage information to monitor the disk usage. Because the storage information includes the usage of virtual memory and physical memory, there will be false positives. When setting the threshold, you can add two additional rules to avoid this:
`descr is not equal to Virtual Memory`
`descr is not equal to Physical Memory`

such as: [org.apache.hertzbeat.warehouse.store.history.greptime.GreptimeDbDataStorage#saveData](https://github.com/apache/hertzbeat/blob/master/warehouse/src/main/java/org/apache/hertzbeat/warehouse/store/history/greptime/GreptimeDbDataStorage.java#L187)

title: [Task] <support for forwarding alarm messages from third-party platforms to hertzbeat>
body:
### Description

Support for forwarding alarm messages from third-party platforms to hertzbeat. 

We use hertzbeat as an alarm center, access alarm information from other platforms, and then process alarm messages uniformly

refer endpoint api `/api/alerts/report`

![image](https://github.com/dromara/hertzbeat/assets/24788200/5e76562f-e159-4b6c-8540-f92d760f73a0)


### Task List

- [ ] support send aliyun alarm message by webhook
- [ ] support send huaweicloud alarm message by webhook
- [x] #1121

### Question

Errors are found by importing ymal files in batches
![04cebe6f5c4af8b4e615f66f6f2ebf2](https://github.com/dromara/hertzbeat/assets/10276100/326342d4-36fb-41ef-b392-d672c9b34420)
One is that the character set needs to be utf8 when the ymal file is saved, and there is another problem that needs to be noted that there needs to be a space after the colon in the filled field. Note that these two points are generally imported without any problems. Or use excel to import.

### Volunteer help

The custom monitoring template yml file configuration is too complicated. It is recommended that developers provide a custom monitoring template yml sharing platform, which allows users to upload their own configured yml files to allow more users to monitor various platform resources more quickly and conveniently. Thank you!

> Can discuss how to do it

I feel that we can make the first version simple and rough directly based on the github warehouse directory. Create a `templates` directory under this warehouse, use reademe to describe the functions clearly, submit the specification and the navigation of each monitoring template YML, and the user directly submits the monitoring template YML In this directory, just update the readme. After a certain amount, our second edition will provide online uploading and downloading in the form of a web browser. readme A document library readme similar to this https://github.com/awesome-selfhosted/awesome-selfhosted

----    
hi thanks for the feedback ğŸ‘
1. The successful forgery of the background token is caused by the same key, you can modify the sureness.jwt.secret in application.yml to a custom key
```yaml
sureness:
  auths:
    -digest
    - basic
    - jwt
  jwt:
    secret: 'CyaFv0bwq2Eik0jdrKUtsA6bx3sDJeFV643R
             LnfKefTjsIfJLBa2YkhEqEGtcHDTNe4CU6+9
             8tVt4bisXQ13rbN0oxhUZR73M6EByXIO+SV5
             dKhaX0csgOCTlCxq20yhmUea6H6JIpSE2Rwp'
```

There is indeed a problem with this piece. We should change the log ERROR to a custom key without modifying the key for the user.

2. When the user enters the system, he cannot view the real monitoring password parameters, because we have encrypted and protected each monitoring password parameter, and the page displays an encrypted password string

I think the version of the page should be relatively old, it is recommended to upgrade to the latest version

title: [Task] <Development of custom template configuration for message notification>
body:
### Description

HertzBeat supports many alarm methods, but the content of message notification is basically solidified and not very extensible, and it is hard-coded in the project through Thymeleaf. In order to meet the various notification needs of different users, we hope to design and implement a notification template management page, which allows users to customize the notification template and choose different templates while selecting the notification method.
Related UI pagesï¼š
![image](https://github.com/dromara/hertzbeat/assets/68422437/8bd2aec4-fc4e-43ab-a49a-bbf341a68eea)


### Task List

1. Design a universal template.
2. Design and implement the notification template configuration management page, and users can configure the template on the UI page.
3. The notification template adaptation supports the content of various notification methods such as nailing, WeChat, email, telegram, discord, etc.

```sql

  `id` bigint NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT COMMENT 'TAG ID',
  `name` varchar(100) CHARACTER SET utf8mb4 COLLATE utf8mb4_0900_ai_ci NOT NULL COMMENT 'TAGæ ‡ç­¾åç§°',
  `value` varchar(100) CHARACTER SET utf8mb4 COLLATE utf8mb4_0900_ai_ci NULL DEFAULT NULL COMMENT 'TAGæ ‡ç­¾å€¼(å¯ä¸ºç©º)',
  `type` tinyint NOT NULL DEFAULT 0 COMMENT 'æ ‡è®°ç±»å‹ 0:ç›‘æ§è‡ªåŠ¨ç”Ÿæˆ(monitorId,monitorName) 1: ç”¨æˆ·ç”Ÿæˆ 2: ç³»ç»Ÿé¢„åˆ¶',
  `color` varchar(100) CHARACTER SET utf8mb4 COLLATE utf8mb4_0900_ai_ci NULL DEFAULT '#ffffff' COMMENT 'æ ‡ç­¾é¢œè‰²',
  `creator` varchar(100) CHARACTER SET utf8mb4 COLLATE utf8mb4_0900_ai_ci NULL DEFAULT NULL COMMENT 'åˆ›å»ºè€…',
  `modifier` varchar(100) CHARACTER SET utf8mb4 COLLATE utf8mb4_0900_ai_ci NULL DEFAULT NULL COMMENT 'æœ€æ–°ä¿®æ”¹è€…',
  `gmt_create` timestamp NULL DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'create time',

) ENGINE = InnoDB AUTO_INCREMENT = 45 CHARACTER SET = utf8mb4 COLLATE = utf8mb4_0900_ai_ci ROW_FORMAT = Dynamic;

) ENGINE = InnoDB AUTO_INCREMENT = 45 CHARACTER SET = utf8mb4 COLLATE = utf8mb4_0900_ai_ci ROW_FORMAT = Dynamic;

> > Strange, there is data in the hzb_tag table, isn't this table corresponding to the tag management in the management background. The list over there is empty, why is there data in the table?
>
> When adding a monitor, two rows of data will be inserted into the hzb_tag table by default. The name is monitorId and monitorName. This error should be that the name and value are repeated when inserting into the hzb_tag table. The table structure exists: UNIQUE INDEX `unique_tag`(`name` ASC, `value` ASC) USING BTREE. I don't know how to get to the side where hzb_tag is inserted. org.dromara.hertzbeat.manager.service.MonitorService#validate will judge that the monitored name cannot be repeated, and I have not reproduced your problem (I have tried both new creation and modification) ![image](https:// user-images.githubusercontent.com/48920254/258685846-d13dd459-ab4b-40dd-9350-1dce18f1a358.png)

Your code judges whether there is the same name in the monitor table. But the exception is in the hzb_tag table. Is the data in the hzb_tag table omitted when deleting the monitoring? In addition, the two intermediate tables should also be deleted.

body:
> Bot detected the issue body's language is not English, translate it automatically. ğŸ‘¯ğŸ‘­ğŸ»ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ§‘ğŸ‘«ğŸ§‘ğŸ¿â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ§‘ğŸ»ğŸ‘©ğŸ¾â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ‘¨ğŸ¿ğŸ‘¬ğŸ¿         
----    
> > > Strange, hzb_tag has data in the table, isn't this table corresponding to the tag management in the management background. The list over there is empty, why is there data in the table?
> >
> >
> > When adding a monitor, two rows of data will be inserted into the hzb_tag table by default. The name is monitorId and monitorName. This error should be that the name and value are repeated when inserting into the hzb_tag table. The table structure exists: UNIQUE INDEX `unique_tag`(`name` ASC , `value` ASC) USING BTREE. I don't know how to get to the side where hzb_tag is inserted. org.dromara.hertzbeat.manager.service.MonitorService#validate will judge that the monitored name cannot be repeated, and I have not reproduced your problem (I have tried both new creation and modification) ![image](https:// user-images.githubusercontent.com/48920254/258685846-d13dd459-ab4b-40dd-9350-1dce18f1a358.png)
>
> Your code judges whether there is the same name in the monitor table. But the exception is in the hzb_tag table. Is the data in the hzb_tag table omitted when deleting the monitoring? In addition, the two intermediate tables should also be deleted.

The code is to judge that the monitor table has the same name. The problem is that if the name is the same, an exception will be thrown directly. It will not go to the operation of inserting the hzb_tag table below; the current logic does not support the insertion of monitors with the same name. According to your description, it will be over when you go to the code position. The error reported in the previous screenshot is returned, not the error reported by the tag table insertion failure.
So I donâ€™t know how the situation you described led to the process of inserting the tag table below. You can look at the database data first. There may be cases where the data in the monitor table you mentioned was deleted but the data in the tag table was not deleted.

----    
> > > > Strange, there is data in the hzb_tag table, isn't this table corresponding to the tag management in the management background. The list over there is empty, why is there data in the table?
> > >
> > >
> > > When adding a monitor, two rows of data will be inserted into the hzb_tag table by default. The name is monitorId and monitorName. Seeing this error, it should be that the name and value are repeated when inserting into the hzb_tag table. The table structure exists: UNIQUE INDEX `unique_tag`(`name` ASC, `value` ASC) USING BTREE. I don't know how to get to the side where hzb_tag is inserted. org.dromara.hertzbeat.manager.service.MonitorService#validate will judge that the monitored name cannot be repeated, and I have not reproduced your problem (I have tried both new creation and modification) ![image](https:// user-images.githubusercontent.com/48920254/258685846-d13dd459-ab4b-40dd-9350-1dce18f1a358.png)
> >
> >
> > Your code judges whether there is the same name in the monitor table. But the exception is in the hzb_tag table. Is the data in the hzb_tag table omitted when deleting the monitoring? In addition, the two intermediate tables should also be deleted.
>
> The code is to judge that the monitor table has the same name. The problem is that if the name is the same, an exception will be thrown directly. It will not go to the operation of inserting the hzb_tag table below; the current logic does not support the insertion of monitors with the same name. According to your description, it is over when you go to the code position , returns the error reported in the previous screenshot, not the error reported that the tag table insertion failed. So I donâ€™t know how the situation you described led to the process of inserting the tag table below. You can look at the database data first. There may be cases where the data in the monitor table you mentioned was deleted but the data in the tag table was not deleted.

Sorry, I missed the content in the post, but I actually wrote it in the title. My operation is to build a monitor called abc. Then delete it, and when creating an abc monitor, an error will be reported. I'll go back and record a video
